segments.text: Those kids are up to no good, and the woman doesn't even see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that wobbly stool, reaching for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her share, not a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're going to fall and hurt themselves, and it's all going to be her fault for not paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she's still drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing this kind of negligence, it's infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to step in and take control of this situation before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I would never let my kitchen get into this state, it's just unacceptable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to slip on that wet floor and really hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR
